content.question: The vector-valued function <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined by <math alttext="h of t, equals, open angled bracket, e to the t power, plus e to the negative t power, comma, e to the t power, minus, e to the negative t power, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is <math alttext="h prime of open parenthesis, natural log of 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open angled bracket, eight thirds, comma, ten thirds, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, ten thirds, comma, eight thirds, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open angled bracket, eight thirds, comma, ten thirds, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.4: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
